intro: Leipoldtia nelii, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a perennial shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and as a border plant. Leipoldtia nelii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
